description: Two storey side extension, first floor rear extension and alterations to the front elevation together with the conversion of the existing building into a single family dwellinghouse (C3 use)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Location Plan (No Ref), Existing Floor Plans (017/PP/003), Proposed Floor Plans (017/PP/001B), Existing & Proposed Elevations (017/PP/002B), Email from Agent Syed Naqvi dated 25/11/13, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1, & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended 2008), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, & 5.9 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), SPD 4, policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (Draft 2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of the repositioned boundary treatment between the site at number 158 Uxbridge Road and the neighbouring property at number 271 Park Avenue (including the siting and design) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details as approved shall be implemented on site prior to prior to the first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the visual appearance of the development, the residential amenity of neighbours and future residents and to ensure that there is adequate vehicle turning space within the site, all in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9 & 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004),  policies 1.1, 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 &  7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.3,  7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | The development hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, which shall be permanently retained thereafter unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 7, policies 1.1, & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 3.5 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2011),  and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | Details of noise insulation of the building envelope against road and aircraft noise (for the proposed extensions) to achieve the requirements of the Council's Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 (Noise and Vibration) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, &  1.2  of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
